books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: The Three Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of recently-pardoned former vigilantes aids Scotland Yard in bringing a gang of thugs and murderers to justice.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: A young girl follows a white rabbit into a strange land of poetry, humor, and whimsy.

books.title: David Harum
books.author: Edward Noyes Westcott
books.summary: An aimless young man leaves the city for a small village to work for a horse-trading country banker.

books.title: Richard II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Richard II’s wasteful spending habits drive his supporters to revolt.

books.title: Harding’s Luck
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A poor orphan boy accidentally discovers magic which sends him into the past and leads to his recovery of a fortune and a lordly title.

books.title: The Plastic Age
books.author: Percy Marks
books.summary: A student at an upscale liberal arts college navigates challenges, pitfalls, disillusionment, and the possibilities of his undergraduate experience in Jazz Age New England.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: Unnatural Death
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An amateur detective’s investigation of the suspiciously-early death of an elderly lady triggers a series of deadly events.

books.title: The New State
books.author: Mary Parker Follett
books.summary: The theory of group organization is formulated and applied in an attempt to design a truly democratic political state.

books.title: The Kural
books.author: Thiruvalluvar
books.summary: An Indian weaver-philosopher expounds on the subjects of righteousness, wealth, and love.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Taras Shevchenko
books.summary: A collection of Taras Shevchenko’s poetry.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by Frederik Pohl ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Ashenden
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short stories based on the experiences of an intelligence agent during World War I.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
